intro: Beta altissima, commonly known as the sea beet, is a robust perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features large, waxy, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. The plant produces tall, flowering stalks with small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Beta altissima is adapted to coastal environments, tolerating saline soils and coastal winds.
